source: Idaho Division of Veterans Services, healthandwelfare.idaho.gov, Disabled American Veterans of Idaho, El-Ada Community Action Partnership

resources.name: Idaho Division of Veterans Services
resources.description: State division providing comprehensive veteran services including benefits, education, advocacy, cemetery operations, and veterans homes

resources.name: 211 Idaho CareLine
resources.description: Free, statewide community information and referral service with comprehensive database including veteran/military member resources

resources.name: Idaho Veteran Resource Directory
resources.description: Comprehensive online directory connecting veterans to state and federal benefits, services, and advocacy

resources.name: El-Ada Community Action Partnership - Veteran Services
resources.description: Community action organization providing employment assistance and supportive services for veterans

resources.name: Disabled American Veterans of Idaho (DAV Idaho)
resources.description: Veterans service organization providing disability benefits assistance and veteran housing assistance information

resources.name: Idaho Veterans Homes Network
resources.address: Multiple locations: Post Falls, Boise, Lewiston, Pocatello
resources.description: State-operated long-term care facilities for aged and disabled veterans with residential services

resources.name: Supportive Services for Veteran Families (SSVF)
resources.description: Program providing guidance, resources, and financial assistance to help veterans secure and maintain safe housing

resources.name: Idaho Housing and Finance Association (IHFA) - Veteran Resources
resources.description: Provides rental assistance, homebuyer education, down payment assistance, and housing support for veterans

resources.name: Veterans Crisis Line
resources.description: 24/7 free confidential crisis support for veterans and families experiencing mental health crises, PTSD, suicidal thoughts

resources.name: Blue Mountain Action Council - Veteran Housing Assistance
resources.address: Ontario, OR (serves Eastern Oregon and Idaho)
resources.description: Organization receiving $11M federal grant to help homeless veterans find housing and essential services

additional_resources.state_employment_preference: Honorably discharged veterans receive 5 preference points for state employment; disabled veterans receive 10 points
additional_resources.occupational_licenses: Military members and families receive expedited processing for occupational licenses with military training credit
additional_resources.va_benefits: https://www.va.gov/ - Comprehensive VA benefits and healthcare

notes: Idaho has secured $11 million in federal grants (2026) to help homeless veterans find housing. Call 211 for local resource referrals or contact the Division of Veterans Services. County Veterans Service Officers available statewide for benefits assistance.
